intro: Canthium simile, commonly known as the African spurred tortoise plant, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardiness. Canthium simile is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant once established.
